result.execSummary:
The defendant Kim L French Koglin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Defendant shall not have any violent contact with J.L.K., DOB: 6-2-99, or John K.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent, including AODA assessment/treatment.

Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Jail for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

Defendant shall submit to random blood, breath or urine drug screens.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kim L French Koglin

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Documents verified with scanning; Paper file destroyed, retained electronically (scanned).
Faxed Order signed 3/3/16 to Atty Flynn and Probation
Defendant allowed to travel to Mexico between 3/5/16 and 3/12/16 while serving her present probation sentence in this case
Letter received from Atty Jennifer Flynn
Per Deputy DA Stephanie Hanson, no objection to Defendant's letter dated 3-02-16 regarding request for travel.
Victim does not request to be present for hearings

Defendant in person & by Atty. Jennifer Flynn.  Atty Mark David Bensen appeared for State.  Resolution reached.  Resolution reached; State moves to dismiss and read in Cts. 1 and 2.  Guilty plea entered on Ct. 3.  Court finds Defendant guilty on Ct. 3 and orders Cts. 1 and 2 dismissed and read in.  Argument by counsel.  Court proceeds to sentencing.  Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Jail for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.   Court informs Defendant of DNA expungement rights.
Letter received from Atty Jennifer Flynn with attachments
Atty Jennifer Flynn appearing for Def.  Atty Sandra Jo Giernoth for State.  Counsel's first appearance.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 2, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
No violent contact with JLK or JK; Absolute sobriety

Def appears in custody & w/Atty. Katherine Romanowich from the State Public Defenders Office.  Atty Mark D. Bensen for State.  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Court informs Defendant of DNA expungement rights.  Argument on bond.  $1,000 signature bond set.  Adjourned to allow defendant to appear with an attorney.  Hearing scheduled for January 6, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
